issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

fields.summary: instance_type property of services.imaging is not honored

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
[~mdshaonimran] noticed that the VMDK import test has been failing in CI. It looks like vmtype set by the  'services.imaging.worker.instance_type' property is being ignored and imaging workers are being launched using the default vmtype 'm1.small'. This type is too small for our default vmdk image used in CI so the test is failing. 


{code}
In [17]: tc.sysadmin.show_properties('instance_type')
[2015-09-14 22:27:38,397][INFO][SystemConnection]: 
+-------------------------------------------+--------------+--------+--+----------------------------------------+
|PROPERTY NAME                              |PROPERTY VALUE|DEFAULT |RO|DESCRIPTION                             |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------+--------+--+----------------------------------------+
|services.database.worker.instance_type     |m1.small      |m1.small|F |instance type for database server       |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------+--------+--+----------------------------------------+
|services.imaging.worker.instance_type      |m3.xlarge     |m1.small|F |instance type for imaging worker        |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------+--------+--+----------------------------------------+
|services.loadbalancing.worker.instance_type|m1.small      |m1.small|F |instance type for loadbalancer instances|
+-------------------------------------------+--------------+--------+--+----------------------------------------+

comments.body:
Hi [~vasya]
[root@c-22 ~]# euform-describe-stacks verbose
STACK	euca-internal-imaging-service	CREATE_COMPLETE	Complete!	Imaging worker stack	2015-09-14T16:53:10.198Z
PARAMETER	CERTARN		****
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-39a2f4fe
PARAMETER	InitScript		
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.small
PARAMETER	KeyName		
PARAMETER	NtpServer		
PARAMETER	LogServer		
PARAMETER	LogServerPort		514
PARAMETER	ImagingServiceUrl		imaging.localhost
PARAMETER	EuareServiceUrl		euare.localhost
PARAMETER	ComputeServiceUrl		compute.localhost
PARAMETER	VmExpirationDays		180
PARAMETER	AvailabilityZones		one
PARAMETER	NumberOfWorkers		1

This is not a bug. QA set up starts instances with esi-manage-stack BEFORE setting up instance type to  m1.medium.
This is from the log:
{code}
10.111.1.105] out: [2015-09-15T18:35:31-07:00] INFO: execute[source /root/eucarc && export EUCALYPTUS=/ && http_proxy="" esi-manage-stack -a create imaging] ran successfully
[10.111.1.105] out: 
[10.111.1.105] out:     - execute source /root/eucarc && export EUCALYPTUS=/ && http_proxy="" esi-manage-stack -a create imaging
[10.111.1.105] out:   * execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist="*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com"] action run[2015-09-15T18:35:32-07:00] INFO: Processing execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist="*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com"] action run (eucalyptus::configure line 226)
[10.111.1.105] out: [2015-09-15T18:35:32-07:00] INFO: execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist="*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com"] ran successfully
[10.111.1.105] out: 
[10.111.1.105] out:     - execute source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist="*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com"
[10.111.1.105] out:   * execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p services.imaging.worker.instance_type="m1.medium"] action run[2015-09-15T18:35:32-07:00] INFO: Processing execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p services.imaging.worker.instance_type="m1.medium"] action run (eucalyptus::configure line 226)
[10.111.1.105] out: [2015-09-15T18:35:32-07:00] INFO: execute[source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p services.imaging.worker.instance_type="m1.medium"] ran successfully
[10.111.1.105] out: 
[10.111.1.105] out:     - execute source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p services.imaging.worker.instance_type="m1.medium"
{code}

Okay, so I guess we have to do one of the followings:

a) change instance_type before running create imaging
b) delete and create imaging again after changing the instance_type

[~shaon]
Just a heads up, we'll need to poll the stack's state after the delete. Looks like we can not re-create the stack until the previous one is completely removed. Create ops will fail somewhat silently in the meantime. I think [~vasya] is lookign into returning the stack info (including state) during create and delete ops with the esi tool, we'll still need to poll for automation. 
Thanks,
-M

[~mclark], I've changed esi-manage-stack to output info about stack state if create or delete is not possible. I'd also suggest to to set vm type before starting stack and don't re-create it. I don't see why you should do that.

This requires a change to eucalele + the cookbook. 

* Eucalele needs to not set this property
* The cookbook needs an attribute for this that sets it at the right time
